title: Authors and Citation
text: Jaime Salvador. Author, maintainer. CELADE. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Salvador J (2024). redatamx: R Interface 'Redatam' Library. R package version 1.0.0, https://ideasybits.github.io/redatamx4r, https://github.com/ideasybits/redatamx4r.
code: @Manual{,   title = {redatamx: R Interface to 'Redatam' Library},   author = {Jaime Salvador},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0, https://ideasybits.github.io/redatamx4r},   url = {https://github.com/ideasybits/redatamx4r}, }

title: R Interface to Redatam Library
text: redatamx package work REDATAM databases RXDB (new) DICX (old) format.

title: R Interface to Redatam Library
text: install R package, run following command:
code: # Install released version from CRAN install.packages("redatamx")

title: R Interface to Redatam Library
text: Redatam package enables use REDATAM databases inside R. posible open REDATAM dictionary (dicx format new rxdb format) run Redatam programs written SPC language. example: need replace path//nmir.rxdb point NMIR dictionary (Redatam database). running program, find new dataframe tbl1 corresponds output REDATAM program. can use R commands operate new dataframe, outputs commands :
code: library(redatamx)  # open a dictionary dic<-redatam_open("path/to/nmir.rxdb")  # run a frequency usig the new syntax tbl1<-redatam_query(dic, "freq person.sexo")  #-- you can use the old syntax too #-- tbl1<-redatam_query(dic, "table t1 as frequency person.sexo")  print(tbl1)  # close the dictionary redatam_close(dic) ##  SEXO1_value SEXO1_label  value ##            1      Hombre  26834 ##            2       Mujer  25355

title: R Interface to Redatam Library
text: package created supported Jaime Salvador (jaime.salvador@ideasybits.com). REDATAM software developed CELADE.

title: Environment for Outputs Tables — outputs
text: environment created store outputs generated Redatam program execution. environment contains TABLES (Redatam outputs) generated FREQ, AREALIST, MATOP, TABLIST commands. modify objects contained environment.

title: Environment for Outputs Tables — outputs
text: object class environment length 0.

title: Environment for Outputs Tables — outputs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ dic<-redatam_open("c:/nmir/nmiresp.rxdb") df<-redatam_query(dic,"tbl1<-freq person.sexo") # Accessing the tbl1 object from environment redatam::outputs$tbl1 # Accessing the output from Global Environment print(tbl1) } # }

title: Close dictionary — redatam_close
text: Close REDATAM database.

title: Close dictionary — redatam_close
text: dic Dictionary ID (returned 'redatam.open')

title: Close dictionary — redatam_close
text: return value.

title: Close dictionary — redatam_close
text: Jaime Salvador

title: Close dictionary — redatam_close
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ dic<-redatam_open("path/to/rxdb") # run some queries using 'query' or 'run' redatam_close(dic); } # }

title: Execute a Redatam command from text — redatam_query
text: Execute Redatam command: TABLE AREALIST. function removes rows contain total, na mv values. Additionally, function removes "mask" columns.

text: dic Dictionary identifier spc Program text SPC format tot.omit Omit rows containing total, na y mv values

title: Get the Redatam API version — redatam_version
code: redatam_version() #> [1] "RedEngine 1.0.0-RC2 - Linux, compiled by 'GNU C++ version 11.4.0' on 'Oct 11 2024'"

what: redatamx: R Interface to 'Redatam' Library — redatamx-package
title: redatamx: R Interface to 'Redatam' Library — redatamx-package
text: Provides API work 'Redatam' (see https://redatam.org) databases formats: 'RXDB' (new format) 'DICX' (old format) running 'Redatam' programs written 'SPC' language. wrapper around 'Redatam' core provides functions open/close database (redatam_open()/redatam_close()), list entities variables database (redatam_entities(), redatam_variables()) execute 'SPC' program gets results data frames (redatam_query(), redatam_run()).

title: redatamx: R Interface to 'Redatam' Library — redatamx-package
text: Maintainer: Jaime Salvador jaime.salvador@ideasybits.com (ORCID) contributors: CELADE [copyright holder]

title: Redatam R package version 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-10-29 First working version. Initial CRAN submission.
